sen.j: 文久永宝（ぶんきゅうえいほう）は、幕末に流通した銭貨。
sen.e: Bunkyu Eiho coin was the coin circulated at the end of the Edo period.
Bunkyu Eiho coin was a coin circulated at the end of the Edo period.
Bunkyu Eiho coin was a coin circulated at the end of the Edo period.

sen.j: 形状は円形で、中央部に正方形の穴が開けられている。
sen.e: It was a round shaped coin with a square hole in the center.
It was a round shaped coin with a square hole in the center.
It was a round shaped coin with a square hole in the center.

sen.j: 表面には「文 久 永 寳(宝)」の文字が上下右左の順に刻まれ、裏面には波形模様が刻まれている。
sen.e: On the the head of the coin, each of the four characters "文 久 永 寳(宝)" was coined in the order of top, buttom, right and left.
On the head of the coin, each of the four characters "文 久 永 寳(宝)" was engraved in the order of top, bottom, right and left.
sen.cmt: 「訳漏れ」 裏面には…刻まれている。の部分がありません。On後のtheを変更しました。coinedをengravedに変更しました。buttomのミススペルを修正しました。
sen.e: On the head of the coin, each of the four characters "文 久 永 寳(宝)" is engraved in the order of top, bottom, right and left, and on the tail, wave patterns are engraved.
sen.cmt: 翻訳者により訳漏れ対応済みです。

sen.j: この「文 久 永 寳(宝)」の文字には三種類のものがあり、それぞれ能筆の幕閣が担当した。
sen.e: Three styles of writing were used to engrave "文 久 永 寳 (or 宝)" and each writing was taken care of by the cabinet official of the skilled calligrapher of each writing style.
Three writing styles were used to engrave '文 久 永 寳 (or 宝)' and each writing was created by a cabinet official who was a skilled calligrapher.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従って、ダブルクォーテーションをシングルクォーテーションに変更しました。また、より自然な表現となるように文全体を左記のように変更しました。
sen.e: Three writing styles were used to engrave '文 久 永 寳 (or 宝)' and each writing was created by a cabinet official who was a skilled calligrapher.

sen.j: 「文」字が楷書体のものは若年寄・小笠原長行の筆によるもので「真文（しんぶん）」であり、草書体の「攵」となっているものが老中・板倉勝静の筆によるもので「草文（そうぶん）」であり、草書体で「寳」の字が「宝」となっているものが政事総裁・松平慶永の筆によるもので「略宝（りゃくほう）」と呼ばれる。
sen.e: The character "文"engraved in the Kaisho-tai (square style of writing) was by Nagamichi OGASAWARA, wakadoshiyori, and called "sobun", and the character "攵" was by Katsukiyo ITAKURA, roju (senior councilor), and called "sobun", and the character "寳," spelt "宝"in the Sosho-tai (cursive style writing), was by Yoshinaga MATSUDAIRA, the president of the political affairs and tasks, and called Ryakuho.

The character '文' engraved in the Kaisho-tai (square style of writing) was originally written by Nagamichi OGASAWARA, wakadoshiyori, and called 'shinbun,' the character '攵' engraved in the Sosho-tai (cursive style writing) was originally written by Katsukiyo ITAKURA, roju (senior councilor), and called 'sobun,' and the character '寳,' spelt '宝'in the Sosho-tai (cursive style writing) was originally written by Yoshinaga MATSUDAIRA, the president of the political affairs and tasks, and called 'Ryakuho'.
sen.cmt: 指示書に従って、ダブルクォーテーションをシングルクォーテーションに変更しました。Sobunをshinbunに変更しました。「攵」の前の草書体が抜けていたので入れました。Byの前にoriginally writtenをいれました。
sen.e: The character '文' engraved in the Kaisho-tai (square style of writing) was originally written by Nagamichi OGASAWARA, wakadoshiyori, and called 'shinbun,' the character '攵' engraved in the Sosho-tai (cursive style writing) was originally written by Katsukiyo ITAKURA, roju (senior councilor), and called 'sobun,' and the character '寳,' spelt '宝'in the Sosho-tai (cursive style writing) was originally written by Yoshinaga MATSUDAIRA, the president of the political affairs and tasks, and called 'Ryakuho'.

sen.j: 銅製で、直径0.9寸(約2.7センチメートル)、規定量目は9分(約3.375グラム)と、初期の寛永通宝より軽めである。
sen.e: It was made of copper, 2.7 centimeters in diameter, and its prescribed weight was 3.375 grams, which was lighter than that of the early Kanei-tsuho (coins).
It was made of copper, approx. 2.7 centimeters in diameter, and its prescribed weight was approx. 3.375 grams, which was lighter than that of the early Kanei-tsuho (coins).
sen.cmt: 数値の前にapprox.を入れました。
sen.e: It was made of copper, approx. 2.7 centimeters in diameter, and its prescribed weight was approx. 3.375 grams, which was lighter than that of the early Kanei-tsuho (coins).

sen.j: 鋳造は、文久3年(1863年)2月から慶応3年(1867年)まで。
sen.e: Casting was done between 1863 and 1867.
The coin was cast from February, 1863 to 1867.
sen.cmt: 2月が抜けているので入れました。また、より自然な表現となるように文全体を左記のように変更しました。
sen.e: The coin was cast from February, 1863 to 1867.

sen.j: 貨幣価値は4文 (通貨単位)として通用した。
sen.e: Its monetary value (currency unit) was four mon (currency unit during the Edo period).
Its monetary value (currency unit) was four mon (currency unit during the Edo period).
Its monetary value (currency unit) was four mon (currency unit during the Edo period).

sen.j: 万延元年（1860年）から鋳造が始まった寛永通宝鉄当四文銭が不評であり、かつ鋳造コストがかさむものであった。
sen.e: As iron made Kanei-tsuho Shimonsen coin casted from 1860 was unpopular and costs for its casting was expensive, the material of Shimonsen was changed to the original bronze; however, as the price of copper hiked due to the lack of its production, it was decided to issue Shisenmon coins of copper with less quantity.
Iron made Kanei-tsuho shimonsen coin cast from 1860 was unpopular and the casting cost was high.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。castedをcastにしました。また、より自然な表現となるように文全体を左記のように変更しました。
sen.e: Iron made Kanei-tsuho shimonsen coin cast from 1860 was unpopular and the casting cost was high.

sen.j: そのため、四文銭を銅銭に復帰することとしたが、産出量の絶対的不足から生じた銅地金の高騰などから量目を減じた銅四文銭を発行することになった。
sen.e: Thus, shimonsen was changed to the original bronze coin, however, the price of copper rose due to a lack of production, so shisenmon coin was made with less copper.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。より自然な表現となるように文全体を左記のように変更しました。
sen.e: Thus, shimonsen was changed to the original bronze coin, however, the price of copper rose due to a lack of production, so shisenmon coin was made with less copper.

sen.j: 寛永通宝真鍮当四文銭はこれまで原則として銀座 (歴史)指導監督の下で鋳造されてきたが、文久永寳については、銀座監督の下で江戸深川_(江東区)千田 (江東区)新田（大工町）の銭座において鋳造されたものは「真文」のものであり、金座指導監督となった浅草橋場（小菅）の銭座では「草文」と「略宝」のものであった。
sen.e: Kanei-tsuho Shimonsen coin was mainly casted in Ginza, however, Bunkyu-eiho coins casted in ginza of Edoshinkawa, Senda, and Nitta (Daiku cho) in Koto ward were in the "shinbun" style and other Bunkyo-eiho coins casted in kin-za of Asakusabashijo (Kosuge) were in the "sobun" and "ryakuho" styles.
sen.cmt: 地名の「江戸深川_(江東区)千田 (江東区)新田（大工町）」の部分が、よく分かりませんでした。「江東区の江戸深川、千田、新田（大工町）」として訳してあります。-->寛永通宝真鍮当四文銭↓これまで原則として銀座指導監督の下で鋳造されてきた。文久永寳↓銀座監督の下で江戸深川千田新田（大工町）の銭座で鋳造されたものは「真文」金座指導監督の下で浅草橋場（小菅）の銭座で鋳造されたものは「草文」と「略宝」
sen.e: Kanei-tsuho Shimonsen coin was mainly cast and supervised at the office in Ginza and Bunkyu-eiho coins cast in Ginza of Edo-fukagawa-senda-shinden were in the "shinbun" style and other Bunkyo-eiho coins cast in Kinza of Asakusabashijo (Kosuge) were in the "sobun" and "ryakuho" style.
sen.cmt: 銀座が地名として訳されており、指導監督の下という部分が訳出されていません。また、銀座の指導の下、深川などの銭座においての部分も訳出されておらず、全く原文とは異なった訳になっています。その他、寛永通宝真鍮当四文銭から真鍮が抜けていたり、castがcastedとなっていたり、ケアレスミスも多く含まれています。翻訳者に再度翻訳をお願いします。→翻訳者再翻訳済みです。
sen.e: In principle, Kanei-tsuho Shimonsen coins had been cast under the supervision of the gin-za; however, Bunkyu-eiho coins cast at the gin-za in Fukagawa (Koto Ward), Senda (Koto Ward), and Shinden (Daikucho) in Edo under the supervision of the gin-za were in the 'shinbun' style, while Bunkyo-eiho coins cast at the zeni-za in Asakusabashijo (Kosuge) under the supervision of the kin-za were in the 'sobun' and 'ryakuho' styles.
sen.cmt: casted→castに修正しました。原文に合わせて修正

sen.e: According to the analysis of Japan Mint, the composition of the coin was 0.060% silver, 83.107% bronze, 11.227% lead, 3.217% tin, 0.269% iron, 0.269% antimony, 1.500% arsenic, 0.387% sulfer.

According to the analysis made by Japan Mint in the Meiji period, the composition of the coin was 0.060% silver, 83.107% bronze, 11.227% lead, 3.217% tin, 0.269% iron, 0.489% antimony, 1.500% arsenic, and 0.387% sulfur.
sen.cmt: 明治時代のが抜けているのでいれました。また、アンチモンの％が誤っているので、修正しました。0.387% の前にandを入れました。Sulferのミススペルを修正しました。
sen.e: According to the analysis made by Japan Mint in the Meiji period, the composition of the coin was 0.060% silver, 83.107% bronze, 11.227% lead, 3.217% tin, 0.269% iron, 0.489% antimony, 1.500% arsenic, and 0.387% sulfur.

sen.j: 安政年間から引換回収された寛永通寳一文銅銭2,114,246,283枚の内、1,420,200,000枚を文久永寳に改鋳したとされ、文久永寳の総鋳造高は891,515,631枚との記録もある。
sen.e: Among the 2,114,246,283 Kanei-tsuho Ichimonsen coins recalled, 1,420,200,000 were recasted as Bunkyu-eiho coin; also, according to a record, the total number of Bunkyu-eiho coins casted was 891,515,631.

Among the 2,114,246,283 Kanei-tsuho do ichimonsen coins recalled, 1,420,200,000 were recast as Bunkyu-eiho coin; also, according to a record, the total number of Bunkyu-eiho coins cast was 891,515,631.
sen.cmt: ichimonsenの前にdoを入れました。Recastedおよびcastedをrecastおよびcastに変更しました。
sen.e: Among the 2,114,246,283 Kanei-tsuho do ichimonsen coins recalled, 1,420,200,000 were recast as Bunkyu-eiho coin; also, according to a record, the total number of Bunkyu-eiho coins cast was 891,515,631.

sen.j: 発行当初は、真鍮四文銭の代わりに差支えなく通用するよう通達が出された。
sen.e: At the beginning, the government ordered people to circulate Bunkyu-eiho coins as the substitute of shinchu shimonsen coin, however, in reality, it was difficult not to admit that their rates could not be treated the same in the market; in 1865, the rates of the coins were regulated as follows: one Tetsu ichimonsen coin for 12 mon of Kanei-tsuho shinchu shisen coin and 8 mon of Bunkyu-eiho coin; in 1867, free rate system was employed and the rates became the followings with the standard rate of Tetsu ichimonsen = one mon:

At the beginning, the government ordered people to circulate Bunkyu-eiho coins as the substitute of shinchu shimonsen coin, however, in reality, it was difficult not to admit that their rates could not be treated the same in the market; in June 1865, the rates of the coins were regulated with more premium as follows: one Tetsu ichimonsen coin for 12 mon of Kanei-tsuho shinchu shisen coin and 8 mon of Bunkyu-eiho coin; in 1867, free rate system was employed and the rates became the followings with the standard rate of Tetsu ichimonsen = one mon:
sen.cmt: 「訳漏れ」…閏5月、増歩通用が抜けています。また、文章が長すぎるのと、it was difficult not to admit that their rates could not be treated the sameの2重否定で、非常に意味がわかりにくくなっています。また、ミススペルもあるようなので、この部分は翻訳者に再度翻訳をお願いします。→翻訳者により訳漏れ対応済みです。
sen.e: At first, the government ordered people to circulate Bunkyu-eiho coins as a substitute for shinchu shimonsen coin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: が、市場における差別通用の実態を追認せざるを得なくなった。
sen.e: However, they could not help admitting that, in reality, their rates could not be treated in the same way on the market.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 慶応元年（1865年）閏5月には鉄一文銭に対し、寛永通寳真鍮四文銭は12文、文久永寳は8文の増歩通用となった。
sen.e: In June 1865, the rates of the coins were regulated so as to give them the following premium: one Tetsu ichimonsen coin was worth 12 mon of Kanei-tsuho shinchu shimonsen coin or 8 mon of Bunkyu-eiho coin.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処shisen →shimonsen

sen.j: 慶應3年（1867年）には自由相場（天然相場）に任されることとなり、鉄一文銭＝1文の基準に対し以下のような相場となった。
sen.e: In 1867, a free-rate system was employed, resulting in the following rates, with the standard rate of Tetsu ichimonsen equal to one mon:
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 寛永通寳銅一文銭：10～12文
sen.e: Kanei-tsuho ichimon sen coin: 10 - 12 mon
Kanei-tsuho do ichimonsen coin: 10 - 12 mon
sen.cmt: 銅が抜けているので、入れました。
sen.e: Kanei-tsuho do ichimonsen coin: 10 - 12 mon

sen.j: 寛永通寳真鍮四文銭：20～24文
sen.e: Kanei-tsuho shinchu shimonsen coin: 20 - 24 mon
Kanei-tsuho shinchu shimonsen coin: 20 - 24 mon
Kanei-tsuho shinchu shimonsen coin: 20 - 24 mon

sen.j: 文久永寳：15～16文
sen.e: Bunkyu-eiho coin: 15 - 16 mon
Bunkyu-eiho coin: 15 - 16 mon
Bunkyu-eiho coin: 15 - 16 mon

sen.j: 天保通宝：80～96文
sen.e: Tenpo-tsuho coin: 80 - 96 mon
Tenpo-tsuho coin: 80 - 96 mon
Tenpo-tsuho coin: 80 - 96 mon

sen.j: 寛永通寳鉄四文銭：2文
sen.e: Kanei-tsuho shimonsen coin: 2 mon
Kanei-tsuho tetsu shimonsen coin: 2 mon
sen.cmt: 鉄が抜けているので、入れました。
sen.e: Kanei-tsuho tetsu shimonsen coin: 2 mon

sen.j: 寛永通寳鉄一文銭：1文
sen.e: Kanei-tsuho tetsu ichisen coin: 1 mon
Kanei-tsuho tetsu ichimonsen coin: 1 mon
sen.cmt: monが抜けているので、入れました。
sen.e: Kanei-tsuho tetsu ichimonsen coin: 1 mon

sen.j: この相場を元に新貨条例制定後の旧銅貨の通用価値が規定され、一圓は一両と等価となり、一両＝10000文という基準から、これらの銭貨は以下の様な通用価格となった。
sen.e: Based on this market price, the old copper coin was regulated after the establishement of New Currency Regulation; one yen became equivalent to one ryo; furthermore, using the standard rate of one ryo = 10000 mon, the currency rates of the coins became the following:

The value of the old copper coin after the establishment of New Currency Regulation was set based on this market price; one yen became equivalent to one ryo; furthermore, using the standard rate of one ryo = 10000 mon, the currency rates of the coins became the following:
sen.cmt: establishement のミススペルを修正しました。より自然な表現になるように左記のように修正しました。
sen.e: The value of the old copper coin after the establishment of New Currency Regulation was set based on this market price; one yen became equivalent to one ryo; furthermore, using the standard rate of one ryo = 10000 mon, the currency rates of the coins became the following:

sen.j: 寛永通寳銅一文銭：1厘
sen.e: Kanei-eiho do ichimonsen coin: 1 ri
Kanei-tsuho do ichimonsen coin: 1 ri
Kanei-tsuho do ichimonsen coin: 1 ri

sen.j: 寛永通寳真鍮四文銭：2厘
sen.e: Kanei-eiho shinchu shimonsen coin: 2 ri
Kanei-tsuho shinchu shimonsen coin: 2 ri
Kanei-tsuho shinchu shimonsen coin: 2 ri

sen.j: 文久永寳：1.5厘
sen.e: Bunkyu-eiho coin: 15 ri
Bunkyu-eiho coin: 1.5 ri
Bunkyu-eiho coin: 1.5 ri

sen.j: 天保通寳：8厘
sen.e: Tenpo-tsuho coin: 8 ri
Tenpo-tsuho coin: 8 ri
Tenpo-tsuho coin: 8 ri

sen.j: 寛永通寳鉄四文銭：8枚で1厘
sen.e: Kanei-tsuho tetsu shimonsen coin: 1 ri with 8 coins
Kanei-tsuho tetsu shimonsen coin: 1 ri with 8 coins
Kanei-tsuho tetsu shimonsen coin: 1 ri with 8 coins

sen.j: 寛永通寳鉄一文銭：16枚で1厘
sen.e: Kanei-eitsu tetsu ichimonsen coin: 1 ri for 16 coins
Kanei-tsuho tetsu ichimonsen coin: 1 ri for 16 coins
Kanei-tsuho tetsu ichimonsen coin: 1 ri for 16 coins

sen.j: これらの内、鉄銭は明治6年（1873年）12月25日に、天保通寳は明治24年（1891年）末をもって通用停止となったが、文久永寳などの銅銭は昭和28年（1953年）末の「小額通貨の整理及び支払金の端数計算に関する法律」により廃貨措置がとられるまで法的に通用力を有した。
sen.e: Among these coins, Tetsusen coin was abolished on December 25, 1873, and Tenpo Tsuho coin in 1891, however, bronze coins such as Bunkyu eiho coins were still legally vaild until the enactment of the "Small Currency Disposition and Fractional Rounding in Payments Act" Shōgaku tsūka no seiri oyobi shiharaikin no hasūkeisan ni kan suru hōritsu) that abolished.

Among these coins, Tetsusen coin was abolished on December 25, 1873, and Tenpo Tsuho coin in 1891, however, bronze coins such as Bunkyu eiho coins were still legally vaild until the enactment of the "Small Currency Disposition and Fractional Rounding in Payments Act" Shōgaku tsūka no seiri oyobi shiharaikin no hasūkeisan ni kan suru hōritsu) that abolished.

Among these coins, Tetsusen coin was abolished on December 25, 1873, and Tenpo Tsuho coin in 1891, however, bronze coins such as Bunkyu eiho coins were still legally valid until they were demonetarized by the enactment of the 'Small Currency Disposition and Fractional Rounding in Payments Act' (Shogaku tsuka no seiri oyobi shiharaikin no hasukeisan ni kan suru horitsu).
sen.cmt: 翻訳者により訳漏れ対応済みです。"→'ō→oū→u
